intro: Anaphalis stenocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed mistletoe, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in a dense, woolly inflorescence. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Anaphalis stenocephala is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
